title: [Large-Scale] Mixed-Methods Assessment Design for Measuring Attitudinal Change: Cognitive vs. Behavioral Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Language Proficiency and Experience with Online Learning
context.additional_context: Language-related vocational training program conducted in digitally supported environments

learning_goals: Learners can improve cognitive changes in language usage attitudes by over 20% through quizzes
Learners can demonstrate a 15% or greater change in actual language behavior through individual project performance.
Learners can choose between cognitive assessment (quizzes) and behavioral assessment (individual projects) based on which method is more effective for them.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
